meanings.definition: In a way that shows a lack of respect or approval
meanings.sent1: He spoke disdainfully of the new policy changes at work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher looked disdainfully at the student's incomplete homework.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail disdainfully when offered a vegetable treat.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered disdainfully in the sky, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: She walked disdainfully past the litter on the sidewalk, refusing to acknowledge it.
